title: Verified Purchase
content: I initially felt that Samira married out of Desperation She didn't know much about Rowland and it really seemed as if he was trying to isolate her from her loved Ones. It's crazy that Melanie a dead woman was able to make a woman feel the way Samira was feeling , but that can be expected when you marry someone you barely know. There were a lot of Secrets in this book. Dylan had that much hidden hatred and Jealousy of his cousin and Melanie seemed delusional.  Rowland opened the door for infidelity by accepting it once before marriage. Good Read with a surprise ending.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I credit the author having created a solid plot. The ending was not predictable as it is in many other thriller-style novels and it had a lot of potential. However, the character base completely ruined everything good that was going for this book. The main protagonist is a self-proclaimed freeloader who is equal parts delusional and empty headed. Admits to having no work ethic and relying on brother for financial support well past early adulthood. Is put out when finally, yes finally, she is ‚Äúcut off‚Äù financially so the brother can support his own growing family, and instead of making something of herself, the lead role works a single shift to scrape money to cover utilities (since unashamedly, she won‚Äôt hold a steady job, so her roommate/friend pays all other bills) and doing so just happens to catch the eye of an incredibly wealthy athlete whom she proceeds to promptly marry, despite knowing he may be a murderer? What a win for woman kind. And notice how I said won‚Äôt hold a job.  Not ‚Äúcan‚Äôt‚Äù, the lead character lacks any sense of direction, purpose, or work ethic and is quite content having everyone else pay the bills. Then the counterpart is also incredibly self-centered and selfish female lead. You later learn there is past trauma that supposedly influenced the latter‚Äôs every life decision but even then, it‚Äôs just so incredibly difficult to get into. Throughout I became increasingly frustrated with the every single decision the key female leads made. Its just so incredibly unrealistic and in many cases irrational. Again, the overall plot was good, just so painfully weak in character composition.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: Not gonna lie, I only chose this book because I wanted to fulfill the "Unlock this achievement when you complete one of our Amazon Editor's picks for Black History Month." I am so glad that I did! I've kinda gotten into a reading slump lately. I'll read for 10-30 mins and go to sleep. So it's been taking me weeks to finish a single book. I finished this book in three nights. I couldn't stop reading it. The storyline, the plot, everything about this book captured my attention and did not let it go until I knew the truth. This book is definitely worth the read. I've been sleeping on this author and I regret it. Now to see what other captivating books she's written! Read this one y'all! It's definitely worth it. It'll keep you guessing to the very end! Btw, the prologue is very misleading!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Yall...I ate this book up like it was my last meal! I started and finished it in under 24 hours. I was annoyed I had to stop reading to do things like work and drive lol. Shanora did it again! The Perfect Ruin was my first read by her and that one was spectacular! This one did not disappoint at all. I love that she tied the two books together a little. I love when authors do that. It's like a little treat. I thought I had the book figured out. I was certain I knew what happened but it turns out what I thought happened wasn't what happened at all. I do not want to spoil this book but yall have to read it! I cannot wait for her next release!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
